primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God initiates a movement of election and redemption to bring humanity from the exile of sin back to their true 'home' in His presence, through the substitutionary exile of Jesus.

tekstueel_bewijs: He called you out of darkness into his wonderful light
God is going to... return. His presence will cover the earth
He will get rid of death, he will get rid of suffering
ultimate, real home would be a place in which everything fit the deepest longings of your soul
chosen according to the foreknowledge of God the Father

ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as the Receiver of mercy and the 'Resident Alien' in the world.

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (The Ultimate Exile) and the Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: through the sanctifying work of the Spirit
because of the shed blood of Jesus Christ
helper.rol_van_god: God is both the Subject (initiator) and the Helper (mediator).
helper.rol_van_geest: The Spirit provides the 'sanctifying work' to enable the new identity.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and the 'Not-Home' status of the world
tekstueel_bewijs: sinful desires, which wage war against your soul
This world is no longer home. It’s filled with death.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but the ontological state of being 'lost' from Paradise and the power of Death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Christian living as a resident alien, exhibiting 'good deeds' that are simultaneously offensive and attractive to the world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly fueled by the primary program (soteriology). The hearer only acts because they are first 'chosen' and 'loved'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → Salvation/Home → The Elect

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is going to... fix everything.
He took the exile we deserved.
He called you out of darkness.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You must abstain from sinful desires.
You need to look at Jesus.
We are to live as exiles.

voorbeelden: I urge you... to abstain from sinful desires.
everything fit the deepest longings of your soul
You can’t understand what it means to live the Christian life without the new birth.
Where do we get the power for that?
His resurrected power is in our lives now.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) granted by the Gospel. It assumes the hearer cannot fulfill the 'Devoir' (Duty) without the transformative power of being 'Chosen' and 'Loved'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the state of Exile (S2) to the realization of being a Pilgrim (~S2) because Jesus took the Ultimate Exile (S2), leading to the hope of Home (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in Christus Victor/Substitution: Jesus becomes the Exile so the Exile can become a Citizen.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Death and the 'unfit' nature of the world are presented as insurmountable without divine intervention.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon contains many imperatives, they are structurally grounded in the indicative of God's election and Christ's substitutionary work.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Focus on 'good deeds' as a test
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: How are you doing with that test?

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He took the exile we deserved.
I just loved you because I loved you.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Abraham, Israel) and literary figures (Meriadoc) are used, but they are framed as responses to a greater reality.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this: Israel is a microcosm of the human condition, not just a moral example.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment; the burden of 'creating' an identity is removed by the 'received' identity.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation leading to synergistic sanctification.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Theme' (Identity) to the 'Power' (Christ's work) is logically tight and prevents moralism.
spanning_punten: The 'Test' section briefly risks sounding like a performance review before being anchored in 'Power'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He got the exile we human beings deserved so we could be brought into home.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'sanctifying work' that enables the 'Pouvoir-faire'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a 'war against the soul' and a state of being 'homeless' and 'unhappy'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the primary Subject of the salvation narrative while positioning the hearer as a secondary subject in the ethical narrative.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on Devoir in the middle section.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: The current balance is corrected by the final section on Power.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'Test' is always introduced as a 'fruit' rather than a 'requirement'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in anchoring ethical imperatives in actantial shifts (Christ as the Subject of Exile).

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Home' metaphor; Greimas shows that 'Home' is the Object of a specific divine Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the word 'parepidēmos'; semiotics explains how that word functions as a 'Modal Competence'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'Power' section is not just an appendix but the 'Helper' actant necessary for the Subject to achieve the Object.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'Subject-Switch' where Christ takes the role of the Opponent's victim (Exile) to transform the Receiver's status.
